website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic TY-ER3D4MU are universal glasses compatible with the Full HD 3D and offer decent build quality and appreciably better picture quality than cheap glasses.
pros: The glasses are much cheaper than in previous years and much more streamlined
The glasses are based on the Full HD 3D standard and will work across compatible Panasonic and Samsung TVs
Image quality and fit are noticeably better than the cheaper Samsung glasses
cons: These 2012 glasses won't work with 2011 or earlier Panasonic 3D TVs
Despite the build quality the lenses are still susceptible to damage and to protect your investment we'd suggest storing them away after use
The glasses are still on the pricey side with Samsung and LG producing appreciably cheaper sets

customer_reviews.title: The Battery was Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable! It only works when powered via the USB cable. Even after charging the unit for a few hours with a wall plug, nothing happens when I switch it on; no lights - nothing! it only works when connected to a power source via the USB cable. However, I couldn't even enjoy it wired (as awkward and uncomfortable as that might be) because the Micro USB jack plugs in the worst place possible - under the nose pad! Sadly, I didn't get a chance to try them out for the first time until I was quite past the return window, so now I'm stuck with a useless piece of plastic. Thanks a lot, Panasonic! Nice going!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Hakhverdian

customer_reviews.title: Work great with VT60
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Panasonic TC-P55VT60 TV. They work great and I like them a bit better than the ones that come with the TV, because they have an actual on/off switch on the bridge of the nose. The glasses that come with the TV just have a button that lights up when you turn them on, but then goes off so just looking at them you can't tell if they are on or off. I did buy the 3Active twin storage case and I recommend getting some sort of case for them. The 3Active case is hard cardboard so if you have children or other distructive force in the house I would recommend something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: DVD Addict

customer_reviews.title: Work great with Samsung D, E, ES and F series (2011-2013) 3DTV's
customer_reviews.text: Even though they are made by Panasonic and only advertise their compatibility with Panasonis 3DTVs, I have physically tried these with several models of Samsung 3DTVs that were built between 2011 and 2013, and they appear to work perfectly with all of them. The battery cover on most of my original Samsung SSG-3100GB glasses broke a while back- forcing me to use scotch tape to hold the battery cover on while wearing them. These Panasonic glasses are rechargeable- so no more fussing with battery replacement at all. Best of all, they are now bargain priced comparably with the non-rechargeable Samsung glasses. What a great find!
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses, 4 stars due to a bit of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great glasses, 4 stars due to a bit of crosstalk. I use them with an Epson 2040 projector, glasses paired from 5ft with no issues, image is bright and nice, off/on button is a must have feature. One nice benefit those glasses have - 'mode' button position if you push it to the right is also letting you to make 3D into 2D picture - it is very nice to have if you tired of 3D effects while rest of family keeps watching it. Good product, charges fast and works well, at least for now.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Atkin

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly and have a sturdy design. I also have two pair of the samsung glasses which are about 1/3 the cost. The Samsung's work just as well as far as displaying the 3D images, but they are not as sturdy. Also, the ear pieces on the Samsung do not fold as they do on the Panasonic, so they are harder to store. The Panasonic glasses are also rechargeable (as opposed to a replaceable coin battery in the Sammy's) which is nice, and the Panasonics also block more light coming in from the side which reduces glare and wash out when watching in a room that's not very dark.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, clear and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I read a few reviews stating that these glasses are difficult to sync with a source Panasonic TV. I have a Panasonic VT50 and syncing these glasses was very simple. I have 4 pairs and haven't had any difficulties. The reason I didn't give them 5 stars is the smallish lens. I would prefer something larger but that's a minor issue for me. The 3D quality is very good, with good depth and color rendering. They do darken the picture slightly but you can compensate by increasing the TV brightness when viewing with the glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Redd Bird

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Epson 2040 projector.
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing!!! I'm using these with my Epson 2040 and they work amazingly. Instant auto pairing light weight and they keep the light out. I have a pair of Sony TDG-BT5000A which work well but are heavy and let the light in. So far these are amazing. 2 min charge gets you 3 hours movie time. Half hour charge gets you 30 hours. Go with these I promise they are amazing. Designer look and feel also. Ohhhhh they also have a 2D mode in case someone needs to switch!!!
customer_reviews.author: Duane C.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller Lens size than the non rechargable type.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit dissapointed with these because I had hoped the lenses would be slightly bigger than the ones that came with my Panasonic 2014 55" Plasma but instead they are a bit smaller in size. The only nice part is that they have slightly lighter tint glass in them, so the picture looks a little brighter. Unfortunetly another down side is that the rechargable batteries require charging maintenance while the orginals only require a DIY battery change every few years. Also their is no way to replace the rechargabe battery, the units are meant to be disposed of when the battery fails.
customer_reviews.author: RobbygTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works very well with my Epson 3D Projector. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with my Epson 3D Projector. I do see a small bit of flickering during fast motion, or if I move my head or eyes quickly. This seems to be something that affects me with all active shutter glasses, it's a shame that passive glasses have reduced picture quality. I'd give these 5 stars, but the comfort level is a tad low. They are very "plasticky" and feel cheap in the arms. Fairly lightweight, but would not be able to wear for more than 1 full length movie.
customer_reviews.author: Travis B

customer_reviews.title: A perfect match for my 2012 Viera
customer_reviews.text: Wow, my 3D 65" Viera really does have 3D capability! My bad on the first set of glasses I ordered. They were not bluetooth capable and therefore did not work with my TV. No one to blame but myself for not adequately researching prior to buying. The good news is that these glasses work perfectly, fit comfortably and (so far) hold their charge quite well. I have only used them 3 times, so this review may need updating if long-term use changes my opinion. So far, so good. I have learned that with a Panasonic Viera it's best to use Panasonic camera and glasses.
customer_reviews.author: tsihq

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Very High Quality Original Manufacturer Lenses for Panasonic Viera 3D Plasma Television sets (and possibly other Panasonics using Active Shutter 3D) [Maybe will work with modification on other Television brands using active shutter, wouldn't recommend it..] The Panasonic Viera Plasma screens are legendary incredible displays. Until the OLEDs are mass produced nothing will compare.. Run HSBS or Over/Under 3D to get a 1080P quality 3D movie to play via this set.. Terrific Glasses for an even better Television set!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses - works with my Samsung Plasma
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some higher quality 3D glasses to pair with my Samsung plasma (PN60E550). I already wear glasses, so I was hoping to find something more comfortable than the flimsy pair that came with the television. These glasses work great! They weren't as comfortable until I removed a small nose piece that comes pre-installed. It was easy to remove using a tiny screwdriver. I ordered two pairs and my wife uses a pair with the nose piece intact (she doesn't wear glasses) and also finds them quite comfortable. When I say they are comfortable, I wouldn't recommend wearing these out of the house for fun, but they certainly don't bother me while watching a movie. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding 3D active glasses
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenally better than the cheap Samsungs for active 3D viewing. Works perfectly with my Epson HC2000. Zero issues syncing, etc. These are large enough to fit over my small eyeglasses and comfortable. Quality heft, but not heavy. The 3D to 2D allows others to watch 3D movies in 2D with the rest of the family. Fab!! Certainly worth the $40, and way more. Rechargeable is the way to go
customer_reviews.author: Madden93champ

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Light
customer_reviews.text: I like the glasses. Compared to others I've tried they are most comfortable. I watch a whole 3d movie and don't really notice I have them on. I bought 4 pair to use with my VT50 Panasonic Plasma and I'm happy with the quality, charging time and the price.I've only had them a few months and I'll update this if there are any problems. Update: 1 pair of glasses self destructed about 4 months after purchase. Panasonic had a free warranty replacement in my hand within the week after I sent them back. :) Still very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: GaryGTX

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 pairs of these glasses, exactly as described, only issue was one pair did not work, but Amazon sent replacement pair immediately, no hassles and it was easy/free shipping to send the broken pair back. very satisfied! Pros: fast charging, comfortable, fit over glasses, don't feel flimsy or easily breakable Cons: not with the glasses themselves, but wish they came with some type of case/cinch bag to store them in, it is why I didn't give 5 stars, for the price you pay you could at least get something to put them in to give some amount of protection from scratching, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Columbo

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: I chose the Panasonic glasses as this is the brand of TV that I bought. I figured syncing wouldn't be an issue and as the TV's are a quality product surely the glasses would be as well. Sadly the glasses, specifically the on off switch, is really poorly made and one set of my glasses would no longer turn on or off. Given what the 3D TV's cost I would have expected Panasonic to make a better quality set of glasses. Ironically after my purchase I read numerous reviews in various forums complaining of the same shortfall. Save yourself some aggravation and buy some other brand of compatible glasses as they are bound to be better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: Wow 3D
customer_reviews.text: As far as 3D glasses go I like these. Unless you pay huge bucks the glasses are going to be a little bulky. The charging time and comfort on these glasses are good. I bought these when we got a new Panasonic TV. I have since purchased other brands and would say as long as you can find these a competitive price I would prefer the comfort, quality and charge time on these panasonic glasses. The 3D vision on these glasses was very good but the other two brands were also good in vision. If you can find these for $45 to $65 go with the panasonic. Sorry, I got a little redundant trying to make my point.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Beware Registration Process
customer_reviews.text: The instruction book is not as clear as it should be. The glasses will not register with the TV unless the slide switch is pushed past the "on" position and held for a few seconds until alternating red/green flashes are seen. Then a few seconds later, a solid green light should appear signifying successful registration. The glasses will not register if the switch is simply moved and released in the "on" position. The glasses themselves are OK--better built but much more pricey than the Samsungs we also bought.
customer_reviews.author: Don S.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought sight unseen, I expected these active 3Dglasses to be bulky, heavy and uncomfortable. Quite the contrary. Powered by a super-tiny battery, they are suprsingly light and comfortable. Viewing quality is excellent. As with all 3D glasses, viewing 3D results in some loss of brightness, which you forget about after a few seconds of viewing. Fully charging the battery with the supplied USB cable, they last an incredibly long time before being run down. And if you do run the battery down fully, charging for only 1-2 minutes will get you through one or two movies! Impressive.
customer_reviews.author: 1baysailor

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfy for glasses wearers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after purchasing the PS3 3d eyewear. Turns out those use IR tech which are only compatible for older sets. This Panny pair synced perfectly with my GT50 after the initial 30min charge. I am surprised how light these are and they fit snug over my glasses. Very secure on the face and it fits great without glasses as well. I am using them in a room with no lights and blackout curtains, so I can't speak on light pollution. I also bought the Sammy 4100GB and definitely like these better. The Samsung feels too flimsy, but boy is that price nice. Performance comparisons give me no differences (for my setup).
customer_reviews.author: Sir Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, solid build, but clearly still proprietary mark up in price
customer_reviews.text: These glasses definitely deserve high marks and may be the best active Bluetooth glasses for 2012. However, they simply do not deserve the $20 mark up over Samsung's high end glasses. Not to mention, Panasonic does not include any glasses with the purchase of any of their 3D TVs. Otherwise, build quality is superb, battery life is excellent, and there is minimal cross talk(this is most likely because of the 55VT50 we bought). Definitely buy from Amazon, as the same glasses are $76 at a major electronics store that claims the have the BEST BUYs around town. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Pharr

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are light and comfortable. They fit well over regual glasses. They hold a charge for quite a while and you get a battery level displayed on-screen right after you turn them on. I was initially turned off by the strict warnings from Panasonic to only charge them from the USB ports on the TV which are hard to get to if you have it mounted on the wall - and the set has to be on. But you don't have to charge them very often so it's not a big deal. Eventually, if enough people say it's safe to charge them on a regular USB charger, I'll take the chance.
customer_reviews.author: GLa4g

customer_reviews.title: Worry Free - Name Brand Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Glasses fit nice even over prescription eye wear. Charge fast, and lenses were perfect (no scratches). I had also bought a 3rd party pair at the same time, and the lenses on them were flawed with fine scratches right out of the box. Also the lenses in the Panasonic were not as darkly tinted as the 3rd party ones. I assume it would follow that the 3D image would appear brighter using the Panasonic glasses. I never tried a direct comparison however as I wanted to return the 3rd party glasses as 'un-used' for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H

customer_reviews.title: They Work for the Sony 850c 4K tv line.
customer_reviews.text: These work for the Sony 850c model line. A big issue is the Sony 850c line does not come with 3D glasses. The Sony versions of the glass are $50+ and sometimes very hard to find. Took a little time to figure it out though. Make sure you get them to pair, your tv should say "3D glasses paired". You can do this on a main HDMI input, you DON'T need to use the 3D blue tooth pairing option in the menu. They also look better than the Samsung 3D glasses line that is also compatible with the 850c.
customer_reviews.author: Space Visionary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Well I did a ton of research online regarding 3D glasses for my Panasonic ST50. I bought these and I bought another brand which I found for $28 a pair. Even though these were alot more money, they are worth it. If I wouldn't have been able to compare the two brands, I might have thought the other brand would be OK. However these give a much sharper, more detailed, deeper black/depth when watching a movie. I sent the other ones back and kept these Panasonics. FYI...the other brand begins with the letter S and ends with a C.
customer_reviews.author: denik

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable but not great
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. They sync with my Panasonic Smart/3D tv just fine. However, they seem rather expensive for the price and look/feel VERY fragile. It seems that they could be a little "stronger" for the price. I sure wouldn't allow a child to use them! They are also too large to fit in any eyeglass case that I have seen. I purchased a hard sided Vaultz case to store them in. Because I don't want them scratched, I wrap them in a microfiber cloth before putting them into the box. At this price, the eyeglasses really should come with a storage case for protection.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia D

customer_reviews.title: Great Option for JVC projector (RS 400)
customer_reviews.text: We don't watch a lot of 3D so no expert, but compared to the more expensive Xpand glasses these are lighter which means more comfortable, works very well and easy to sync. I really like that it has an indicator light that blinks when they are active unlike the Xpand brand. Bought 3 pairs of these to use with a JVC RS400 projector and Xpand EX105BT emitter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light, Comfy and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Glasses came partially charged but I charged them fully before using them for any length of time. They wear nice and after a while it is easy to forget you are even wearing them. Connection to the TV was simple, turn them on and you will get a notice on the bottom right of the TV showing them as connected. I particularily liked the fact that I went upstairs for few minutes and when I returned, did not have to reconnect them to the TV downstairs. Cost was great, WAY cheaper than buying at my local Best Buy or even at the discounted Nebraska Furniture Mart. Highly recommend these for an AWESOME 3D experience!
customer_reviews.author: Teeps1206

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic VIERA TY-ER3D4MU Active Shutter 3D Eyewear Panasonic VIERA TY-ER3D4MU Active Shutter 3D Eyewear
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these Panasonic 3D glasses. They pair to my Panasonic GT50 television very easily. Once they are paired all you have to do is turn on the switch on the glasses. Reviews say the Samsung 3D glasses work just as well. I have seen the Samsung 3D glasses. They are cheap and flimsy. I would prefer to purchase products that are designed for my television not another television manufacturer. I also bought them on sale from Amazon for $112 for two pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with my GT50
customer_reviews.text: Glasses work perfectly with my Panasonic GT50, easy to charge since my set has 3 USB inputs. A pouch or something to put these away in would be nice, no cleaning cloth as well. Update: 11/29/12 Glasses are still going strong, Blops 2 looks amazing in 3D. Came here looking to get another pair so my son and I can both enjoy blops 2 in 3D and noticed the price on these went way up since my last purchase. Does anyone know why they have gone up almost $20 in price? Will have to hold off until they go down...they use to be $50.
customer_reviews.author: Baz

customer_reviews.title: These are a perfect match to our 2012 Panasonic 65" Viera 3D plasma
customer_reviews.text: These are a perfect match to our 2012 Panasonic 65" Viera 3D plasma! We ordered a few so everyone in the house had their own set. You can't go wrong at $15 each vs. around $60 in 2012! The battery life lasts for months! It only takes about 15 minutes to get enough of a charge to be able to watch a full movie.
customer_reviews.author: Wal92tt

customer_reviews.title: Glasses work good
customer_reviews.text: They work good on the tv 3d is awesome not much content probably bc wearing 3d glasses after a while give some headaches
customer_reviews.author: Spoilers21

customer_reviews.title: 2012 Panasonic Viera
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable fit, light weight,connect easily to tv, the battery lasts a long time. The quality is heads above the competitors. Its the difference between buying Walmart sunglasses and Oakley sunglasses. Panasonic being Oakley's. You can barely tell you have them on.They also fold closed vs Samsung whose stay open all the time. I have both because we wanted to have extras for company and i wanted to see if it was worth paying $80 more for these ones. And yes its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: laura o

customer_reviews.title: Very, very good.  Just not great.
customer_reviews.text: These are Panny's 2012 version. Most seem to like them better than the 2013 version (which I also have) mostly due to the covers that block light from entering the side view. I prefer the 2013 model just by the way it fits my face and the very slight lens shape difference. The 2012s are rechargable, the 2013s are not. Can't go wrong with either. They sync beautifully. Then again, I have a Panny tv.
customer_reviews.author: Pixx

customer_reviews.title: They work great with 2012 panasonic 3D hdtv
customer_reviews.text: I like these glasses and haven't had any problems with the syncing or image. I usually watch the 2D to 3D effect because I don't own any 3D blurays yet. I notice the 3D more at the edge of the screen which gives the illusion of depth or a floating image. My only "complaint" is that I'm worried about scratching the lenses since they are simply plastic and there was no protective bag included.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Mini USB cables missing in the box.
customer_reviews.text: I realized the mini USB cables to charge the battery in glasses were not included in the box when delivered. Unfortunately I realized it too late as the return window has closed on this item. The glasses work great but once the battery ran down, I thought I would have to replace the battery like I do on my two other glasses. But alas, it's too late. Just sayin', just your packaging to make sure you have the cables so you can get a replacement if needed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Elmquist

customer_reviews.title: Work well. Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Our 3D TV came with two battery-based glasses, and we'd like something more sustaining, so I ordered these. They are just like the others, except they can re-charge. Each unit comes with its own USB charging cord. Your TV should be on to charge them, and it suggests that you not try to charge them on another device (computer, for example). But we have used them for awhile without incident. I would/will purchase these again if we need more.
customer_reviews.author: CSSW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for use with an Epson Home Cinema 3000 projector, as this projector uses standard RF 3D glasses and others have reported that these would work as a substitute for Epson's 3D glasses (model ELPGS03). I have purchased a total of 7 of these glasses and have not had any major issues with any of them. They show a small, but tolerable, amount of cross-talk in high-contrast scenes, but it's hard to go wrong with these for the price. They are very comfortable to wear and the quick-charge feature is very nice to have when you want to watch a 3D movie without having to plan ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Glasses!
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better that the ones that came with my TCP65ST60. They fit better, even with my prescription glasses on. Plus they block out light from the sides. They also are a tad bit brighter while watching a movie than the ones that came with the tv. If you have a 2012 or 2013 Panasonic plasma 3D tv I recommend getting these glasses. A bit pricey but a noticeable difference in fit and viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Larry G.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Compatible
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned choosing an extra set of glasses for my new Epson 3D projector because neither any glasses' manufacturer nor Denon would guarantee compatibility. But these 3D glasses work perfectly with my projector and are equal to the quality of the Denon version, while costing $35 less than the Denon price. I'm very pleased and will probably buy more of these so I can invite more people over to watch 3D movies in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Alan H. Markow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent active 3-D glasses
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are lightweight yet quality (strong), they don't feel flimsy like other 3D classes. I can wear them through a whole movie and they don't bother me at all, you wouldn't even know there are batteries inside. Easy to operate (at least with a Panasonic Viera), and each come with a USB cord for charging. Charging is quick, and I've watched a few movies without needing to recharge. Also, not too bad looking (for 3D glasses).
customer_reviews.author: Panos

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D glasses that work flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Great 3D glasses that work flawlessly. I have the Epson 5030UB projector and it work just as good as the Epson 3D glasses that come with projector. I used to have the Samsung glasses but much prefer these as they are rechargeable as opposed to needing button batteries like the samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Slove

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Panasonic TV and with Epson 6030UB Projector!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 with my Panasonic Plasma. Now, after building a theatre, I am currently using an Epson 6030UB projector on an 118 screen. I wasn't sure if the glasses would work with the Epson, but they work just fine. They have to be synced for first use, but after that it is smooth sailing. The only complaints is that my younger 8 year old daughter finds them a bit big. Overall, they are light, and you don't know you are wearing them. Works like a charm with both, the panasonic TV and the Epson projector.
customer_reviews.author: Picture Man

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I love that you have the option to watch in 2D with the glasses if your watching with your family and don't want the 3D effect. Unfortunately my wife found out by accident lol. As my daughter and I were ooohhing and ahhhing about the effect's in 3D she thought we were over exaggerating. After the second movie she put mine on and was amazed at the difference. I turned her's off and back on and it was once again in 3D and she was happy and ooohing and ahhing with us.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: great product.
customer_reviews.text: Just what i needed i got a used 3D TV made about 3 years ago by panasonic. It did not come with the 3D glasses needed to use that feature. These work great, I only got one pair since I was not sure I was ordering the right product. I am very happy with these and I will be ordering another pair soon.
customer_reviews.author: bryce

customer_reviews.title: The real thing, recently at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: These work well out of the box with an actual 3D BluRay, 3D BluRay player, and 3D capable 2012 Pansonic plasma. Battery lasted through a film with only a partial charge out of the box. I was able to wear them in front of my small Rx lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I look through these glasses and see my tv in 3D. They don't hurt me to wear them. They're very light weight. I turned them on and my TV recognized them immediately. I didn't get a free case to put them in but I don't plan on stepping on them anytime soon. They could be a little bit bigger (I got Mediums) if I'm laying down, but I've got a big head. I'm 6'2" They don't work with older TV's but I checked that before I ordered. I'm sure someone makes a pair of $3000 glasses made out of Ivory and Covenant Space Equipment, but these look amazing.
customer_reviews.author: space_of_donder

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: They work very well. After reading the instructions, I handle them very carefully not to break them or damage the technology. You definitely need to read the manual first. But I was very pleased with the outcome. I've only used them once watching a 3-D movie on my 3-D Blue Ray player. It is nice you can quick charge them for just 2 minutes that will last for three hours. Amazon seems to have the best price on these special glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Great for a bluetooth Samsung
customer_reviews.text: I've used these, 3Active, & XPAND. I prefer these miles away. They're more comfortable, easy to use, less bulky, and have excellent battery life. They pair & work fine with a bluetooth Samsung TV.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Nice but pricey
customer_reviews.text: These glasses work well for my tv but the price is a little too high. As much as I spent on the TV, Panasonic should have included two free pairs. However, I ended up buying the less expensive alternative glasses and have yet to receive them. Will post a review for those once I've had a moment to try them out. If money isn't an object, buy these. They work great. I sent them back because I couldn't justify the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Great extra pair
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a third pair of 3D glasses to go along with the two that came with my Panasonic 3D TV. Although they are not exactly the same as the ones that come packed with the TV (they look the same but these you recharge whereas the ones that come packaged with the TV have a battery), the quality is exactly the same. The 3D effect is exactly the same and the operation is exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Meringolo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!! Great lenses!!
customer_reviews.text: On the first two movies I watched did not get really surprised, but probably was the quality of the image I was looking at, on latest movies with the best effects I've ever seen, it was awesome!!! You feel to be into the movie sometimes. Great product, it has great quality manufacture. I've just charged them a couple of times in 1 month with normal use, I use glasses and have to put the 3D eyewear in front of them but it doesn't makes a difference, you still can enjoy the experience!! I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a really good 3D lenses for their TV. (I use them with a Panasonic VIERA 2012 Plasma 3D TV)
customer_reviews.author: Geiner M

customer_reviews.title: Great, smaller than the original JVC glasses (which I ...
customer_reviews.text: Work perfectly well with my European JVC DLA-X35 (aka RS46 I think in the US). I turned on the 3D on my PC with Windows 10 (right click on the desktop), turned on the projector connected to my PC thru HDMI, switched on the Panasonic glasses close to the projector, and in just a few seconds they were in synch with the existing JVC emitter (ref PK-EM2) without any other bother. Tested a 3D movie immediately with success. Great, smaller than the original JVC glasses (which I will keep for people who have to wear glasses underneath) and so much cheaper than JVC.
customer_reviews.author: GRAS

customer_reviews.title: Beware this product needs some refining
customer_reviews.text: This item worked great for one movie "Avatar". Then it began to shut off and turn on the 3D effect arbitrarily. It makes enjoying a 3D movie impossible since the only way to resume 3D viewing is to manually turn the on off switch to off then on again. Also it appeared that possibly my glasses were repackaged or at least opened and taken out of the box before.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: Amazon isn't selling new OEM Viera 3d glasses so one has to buy the used versions. This review is for the glasses not for the particular used item I purchased second hand. I like the glasses. Setting up the Bluetooth is as easy as turning them to 'on' close to the TV and letting them connect automatically. They produce an awesome effect with the right Blu-ray disks.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Cant go wrong with this supplier...
customer_reviews.text: The product of course is the best you can buy for this TV. We have had no issues with the quality of the product. However, of the 4 units I ordered, 1 was a dud. The seller of course, was nice enough to accept the dud back and refund ASAP. Nice doing business with them. Unfortunately, they did not have a replacement unit, and I had to look elsewhere. I would not hesitate to buy anything else from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Umesh

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I did't expect much given all I have read about 3D not working that great. I was pleasantly surprised at how well they worked. They seem to be built well enough and are comfortable. They fit nicely over my glasses. I love how they charge so quickly in just a couple minutes. The only reason they didn't get 5 stars was because they are little on the expensive side. Also, it would have been nice if they came with a case for the glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I never sync it, I doubt this was for Panasonic g30!
customer_reviews.author: hasan keskin

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I just got a new 3D Smart TV and 3D Blu Ray player so I had to get a couple 3D movies and the 3D glasses. I also ordered Avatar in 3D along with the glasses. The glasses are light and well made. Setup was quick and easy, and they fit right over my regular glasses. I was blown away with the 3D effects. I hope I can find more 3D movies that were this good.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Newman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: The glasses have durable battery usually built in battery devices sold by amazon have their battery at the end of their life cycle. The glasses worked perfect for my P50ST50 Panasonic tv loved the 3d. These glasses get dirty too soon and are really hard to clean up as compare to my far sight glasses. The glasses are heavy too but it works out somehow I will suggest it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ALVI

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: I am not very familiar with 3D technology so I will let someone else speak review the tech specs. I bought this particular set of glasses because I just bought the Panasonic TC-P60GT50 .... glasses arrived quickly and come with a USB cable that plugs into a rear connection on the tv for charging. Haven't watched a movie yet but COD Black Ops 2 is pretty cool in 3D
customer_reviews.author: ECHO444

customer_reviews.title: Great and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These glasses work really well and unleash the awesome 3-D capability of the Panasonic VT series televisions. They are lightweight, link easily to the Panasonic 2012 Viera TVs (good range also), work fairly well over glasses, and recharge quickly. They're well worth the money. My only recommendation is to buy a large glasses case to keep them in.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Lil pricey but very impressive
customer_reviews.text: Got 2x pairs of these to go w/ my Panasonic TC-P60GT50... the combo has literally blown my mind. Glasses pair up quickly and easily as soon as the TV is put into 3D mode. I was always a skeptic of 3D but absolutely love it. These glasses are lightweight and very easy to charge. They are compfortable. Only downside was I paid like $70/ea not upset but still pricey.
customer_reviews.author: rmchl

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a Panasonic TC-P65GT50, and these glasses work great with them. I really like how light they are, and they really do hold a charge for a long time. Also, if you have glasses and are wondering how they work with them, I can tell you that I have had no problems wearing these, they are quite comfortable with or without glasses.
customer_reviews.author: flip_flop

customer_reviews.title: Better than the specifications
customer_reviews.text: These work extremely well. The specs say range limited to 10.5 feet. They work at least to 15 feet ( the farthest I can get from my TV so I cannot give accurate limit) They are comfortable, fast to charge and easy to use. The 3-D is impressive. I never thought home 3-D would be this good. As an aside some NETFLIX blu-rays turn out to have 3-D embedded. BONUS!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Panny Plasma owners
customer_reviews.text: Great but expensive. Just make sure you get the right model for your TV. They get smudged easily so we just clean them with RO water and soft cloth before each time we use them. Easily charged by our PS3 but we can only charge 2 at a time and we have 4. Charge lasts 2 movies at best.
customer_reviews.author: Scottyfree111

customer_reviews.title: 3D looks great
customer_reviews.text: The 3D on my Panasonic TC-P55GT50 looks very impressive with these glasses. My friends and I have played some 3D games and my girlfriend and I have watched half a dozen movies. They all look great. My only complaint is that they're not the most comfortable glasses. It would be nice if they were a bit more flexible for those of us with huge heads.
customer_reviews.author: Alex A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 3D glasses but one quibble
customer_reviews.text: I use these glasses with a Viera 60UT50 plasma TV. They work flawlessly and connect quickly, the colors are great, and the battery life is good. The one issue I have with them is when they turn off because of inactivity, you have to flip the tiny power switch off and then on again rather than just pressing a button.
customer_reviews.author: Neil S.

customer_reviews.title: Great and works with 2013 Panasonic Viera
customer_reviews.text: These work great with my Panasonic viera TV. I believe the TV is a 2013 model. It's nice to be able to recharge them and the price is really great.
customer_reviews.author: Ashfault

customer_reviews.title: Fits better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be heavier but the balance and fit is pretty good. I had two rechargeable glasses with the TV but many times I've had a whim to watch a 3D movie only to find the batteries were dead. It's great having this around since it'll always work for me. Just have extra batteries.
customer_reviews.author: JayJay

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with the Sony XBR55X850C
customer_reviews.text: Works fine with the Sony XBR55X850C, sad thing is the regular 3D aint big deal, so i have to buy the Nvidia 3DTV to see a perfectly displayed 3D :D, but thats another story that has nothing to do with these glasses, they work perfectly :)
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Escoto

customer_reviews.title: The best LCD glasses I've found
customer_reviews.text: A little heavier than the Samsung glasses, but the wrap around style blocks light and visual distractions from around you and makes the 3D experience a lot more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I am new to 3D viewing but thus far I am very impressed. Personally, I prefer them to the few times I have seen 3D movies in theaters. Overall, 3D may be gimmicky but the active technology does look better and if you have a Panasonic 3D tv it is worth picking up a couple sets of these glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Tom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Glasses Very light
customer_reviews.text: Originally I bought the wrong pair of glasses from best buy and after 3 days of trying to figure out why the 3D isn't working I checked the compatibility. I ended up returning the old glasses and then buying these. There very light, rechargable, and display a great image. I would definitly recomend these glasses for the compatable 3d tv.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Miami

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Panasonic 3D TV. It does work and it is very easy to use. And 3D quality is reasonably good. Of course, it is hard to compare it to 3D experience in a movie theater. So lowering your expectation is a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: michaeltdc

customer_reviews.title: Other glasses offer better value
customer_reviews.text: I haven nothing against the glasses, but the price is too high. I bought 3 compatible pair from DimensionalOptics for about $10 less and they also came in cases, which the Panasonic glasses did not. The compatible glasses work great...will see how they last in comparison to the Panasonic glasses.
customer_reviews.author: C. Clines

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 3D glasses to use with my Panasonice Viera ST50. They worked like a charm so I bought a second pair. They're comfortable enough to wear while watching an entire movie. The charge rather quickly too. No complaints. I haven't used any other brands of glasses so I can't say whether these are the best out there but they work fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Callsit Likeiseesit

customer_reviews.title: Creatures flew into the room!
customer_reviews.text: We got the TV and then ordered the 3D glasses. The first time we watched a 3D movie we were thrilled. The creatures came at us and filled the room with movement. Wonderful experience we never expected at home. Since we don't often go to the movie theater, this is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit's Mom

customer_reviews.title: I'm using them on the Panasonic VIERA TC-P60ST60 60-Inch 1080p 600Hz 3D Smart Plasma HDTV
customer_reviews.text: I can't find anything negative to mention about the glasses other than they seem to make the image a little dark, but nothing that a little added brightness can't fix. I'm using them on the Panasonic VIERA TC-P60ST60 60-Inch 1080p 600Hz 3D Smart Plasma HDTV. I watched Prometheus Blu Ray 3D and Avatar Blu Ray 3D, both amazing 3D quality. Images really pop out. Will be purchasing 2 more to have 4 in total.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper Alternative
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to go with my Epson 5020UB projector as they are cheaper than the type that comes with the it. The glasses were automatically recognized by the projector and work just as well as the Epson ELPGS03 glasses. I could not tell that there was any difference in picture quality. The Panasonic lenses are somewhat smaller than Epson's but I don't believe it matters. The instructions warn that the glasses should be charged by connecting the USB adapter to a Panasonic TV or the battery may be damaged. My Epson 110V/USB adapter seemed to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Glasses!
customer_reviews.text: Ok let my start off by saying these are the most comfortable 3D glasses ive ever used and they fit right over my regular glasses no problem! The battery last a LONG time ive had them for over a week and havnt had to recharge them. Syncing the glasses is painless just turn them on and your done all in all some of the best 3D glasses on the market! =D
customer_reviews.author: Jonny D

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are the original glasses for my TV. They are awesome. I paid much less than I could get them in the store and they were new. I received them way ahead of my delivery date. My kudos to the seller for getting them to me fast. I plan to buy a couple of spares for backup.
customer_reviews.author: Dad69

customer_reviews.title: Got these towatch 3D on my Sony XBR-X850C 55"
customer_reviews.text: Got these to watch 3D on my Sony XBR-X850C 55", very happy with these, worked AWESOME!! registered with TV within seconds, comfortable, and fully charge in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Best 3D-Glasses Viera Panasonic units
customer_reviews.text: I tried two other Panasonic compatible 3D glasses and they can not compare to the actual Panasonic for my new Viera TV. The color and clarity is outstanding when you put them side by side. I am extremely happy with this pair and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: El Dude

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer
customer_reviews.text: DONT BUY THESE ! they fail and Panasonic wont do anything about it. Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Miz

customer_reviews.title: Bought these three years ago. Used them once in ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these three years ago. Used them once in the first week. Kept them in the original bag until today, then noticed the coating on both lenses was peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: bobbtall

customer_reviews.title: A must have!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have if you have the Panasonic 3D TV. I purchased this for my husband for Christmas and it is amazing! I can't believe we waited this long to get them! Picture quality is crystal clear and it's a whole different way to watch TV.
customer_reviews.author: Yan G.

customer_reviews.title: Cool, not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These work well and are a fairly descent representation of the current state of 3D television at home. If you look and sit directly in front of the TV then they work, more or less. However, there is so much space around the periphery of ones eye that it makes it difficult to focus on what is happening through the glasses. Making it nearly impossible to become immersed in the 3D experience, which is the point, is it not? Furthermore, the frames of the glasses are not exactly comfortable and need constant adjustment throughout the film. Overall, they are not worth buying unless you are fascinated or involved with 3D. The technology and its logistics still require greater development.
customer_reviews.author: X. Cordero

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic 3D active glasses
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have only used the glasses a few times. We are well satisfied with them and the performance is great. Charge seems to hold very well since I have only had to charge them at the onset. Looking forward to more 3D content across the coming months so we can enjoy them even more.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Nice 3D
customer_reviews.text: Purchase eye-wear for use with new Panasonic Viera 55" plasma TV (TC-P55ST50). Only have two 3D DVD's (Avatar and Alice in Wonderland). Was happy with experience... am 67 and found no problem viewing either movie. Now all I need is a nice selection of 3D TV shows...
customer_reviews.author: John H. Leete

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but kind of wish they were larger
customer_reviews.text: They work as expected, although we had to figure it out on our own how to pair with the TV. That took awhile, and the instructions that came with them did not work for us. I wish they were larger lenses, but I think most 3D glasses are this size.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, synced immediately with our Pana TV and no headaches or nausea. Watched Peanuts in 3-D and it really enhanced the experience.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thadeus Toad

customer_reviews.title: They Work Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: They are easy to set up and work perfectly. They must have arrived charged because they took about 2 minutes to charge. They are light weight and can even be worn over prescription glasses. The 3D was great. However, we are not interested in bothering with 3D in general and will probably not purchase any more 3D movies. The glasses are expensive, so we have only 2 pair--therefore could not show a 3D movie to family/friends. Since the glasses and movies are expensive, to me, they are not worth it for the "kool" factor. But, if you must have 3D, you can count on these glasses working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Geek

customer_reviews.title: Too Expensive But Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The best 3D glasses out there, but, Man, they are expensive and you don't even get a storage case for them. Recharge is a bit awkward but they last a long time. Do not let little children use them, they are delicate with tiny switches.
customer_reviews.author: dpb

customer_reviews.title: Good glasses
customer_reviews.text: Very good 3d glasses. I don't have much experience as this is the first pair I own, but they're light, comfortable and I haven't noticed any artifacts watching a movie, although I am using a projector with frame interpolation to 'smooth' the vision. I like the 3D to 2D function of the glasses if someone don't want 3D while watching a 3D movie.
customer_reviews.author: FrankieMN

customer_reviews.title: So far So Good
customer_reviews.text: These things look great, fit great, and help provide a great picture. I wear glasses and these fit perfectly over them. I am hoping since these are rechargeable that the internal battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: LSR "Don"

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband for Christmas to go with his new Panasonic TV I purchased for him. They work great and fit well. They seem a little light but no complaints here. They plug in to charge instead of having a heavy battery inside them which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Misia

customer_reviews.title: Work well, but need to be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this as AT&T Uverse and Starz released a 3D on-demand movie. They work great, just uncomfortable as I wear prescription glasses. Still they work great. Was easy to set up with my Panasonic Viera TC-P55GT50 TV
customer_reviews.author: jenksdrummer

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic 3D Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Best glasses out there, work beyond believe with their TV's. They have a fast charge to you can watch in minutes right out of the box or a deep charge for multiple movie watching with interruption to recharge. Watch for sales on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were defective at first I didn't realize you have to pair them with your TV in order for them to start working. I'm iwowed by my 65 GT 50 Panasonic TV now in 3-D I thought it was defective was just pairing the glasses ,now it's amazing
customer_reviews.author: Kenn Glenn

product_meta.title: Panasonic VIERA TY-ER3D4MU Active Shutter 3D Eyewear (for 2012 and 2013 Panasonic VIERA 3D TVs)
product_meta.description:
3D Playback Type: Active Shutter 3D Method
Transmittance Method: RF (Bluetooth)/ Full HD 3D Glasses Standard Compatible
Battery Type: Lithium-ion Polymer Rechargeable Battery
Battery Duration: Approximately 30 hours of operation for a 30-minute full battery charge (Approximately 3 hours of operation for a 2-minute battery charge) *The battery duration will change as per the total usage time with the number of charge/discharge cycles 
Package Included: 1 Pair of Eyewear 
Note: These glasses are only compatible with 2012 VIERA HDTVs



Accessory Compatibility Chart

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars583 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
